title.narrative: Empower youth for work Butterfly Works

description.narrative:
IKEA Foundation and Oxfam share the belief that in order to break the spiral of poverty in developing contexts, it is essential to promote a positive enabling environment for young people, especially girls, to thrive and contribute to their community. We share a particular concern for those communities that are hit hardest by climate change.
Working together, we want to ensure that by 2021 over 26,000 young people who are living in rural climate-change affected areas have better economic prospects through the creation ofnew jobs, the improvement of existing jobs and the creation of more lucrative opportunities for youth-led micro-enterprises. Through our advocacy work to change laws and policies and an edutainment campaign around youth rights we aim to reach at least 2,000,000 people in the four targeted countries of Bangladesh, Ethiopia, Indonesia and Pakistan. There is no single approach to achieve this. We propose to launch an integrated and innovative programme based on our theory of change that targets agency, capacity and skills; economic opportunities and policy and norms. From the very beginning through co-creation and through the cycle of the programme we will work closely with local civil society, youth, government, small-medium enterprises (SMEs), and communities to ensure effectivelyand sustainability.

participating-org.narrative: Butterfly Works (BW) is a social innovation studio that creates communication and education projects in emerging economies. Building on 15 years of experience, they apply tools and methods from the creative sector to social issues worldwide. By connecting to talented people across the world, Butterfly Works co-creates tailor-made solutions – never copy-paste and always human-centered. Butterfly Works has a longstanding experience in improving curriculums and works together with existing educational institutions, ministries and young people themselves to set up so-called ‘Bits Schools.’ Bit Schools are schools that provide young people the opportunity to develop their ICT-skills, providing them the future prospect of becoming for example a DTP employee or software developer. In addition Butterfly Works is specialized in the Human Centered Design methodology, designing and piloting solutions with youth to solveissues identified by youth. Butterfly Works will be active in all three countries of Work in Progress and in Indonesia for Empower Youth for Work.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
